articlepost.author: Brian Martin
articlepost.title: Why Is Christopher Nolan’s Film The Prestige Is Underrated?
articlepost.excerpt: Science fiction is concerned with the future. What will the technological advancements of the future decades look like? What will humanity's relationship with new technologies be like? And how far will we go to accomplish and capitalize on such breakthroughs? The Prestige, a film by Christopher Nolan released in 2006, plays with these great concerns.

articlepost.title: How the Oscars Changed Forever by Saving Private Ryan’s Best Picture Loss
articlepost.excerpt: Saving Private Ryan's loss of the Best Picture Oscar to Shakespeare in Love revolutionized the way the Academy Awards were earned.

articlepost.title: The Forgotten Pre-Marvel Action Film of Robert Downey Jr.
articlepost.excerpt: Interest in the United States is surging like a relic from the past. Marshals is a neglected (and substandard) sequel to Harrison Ford's masterpiece The Fugitive, released in 1998. And there's a reason for it: Robert Downey Jr.'s baby face.
